pr_title: fix: retry pdml transaction on EOS internal error

timeline.message:
fix: retries PDML transactions on EOS errors

It is possible to have the stream closed with an EOS internal error.
This should be retried by the client. On this PR we add this retry logic.

timeline.bodyText: This method was just moved down (after the public methods).
timeline.author: thiagotnunes

timeline.bodyText: In this catch block we retry on EOS exception.
timeline.author: thiagotnunes

timeline.bodyText: This is hacky, but unfortunately we do not get a specific exception for this error, so we have to proxy through the exception message. This follows the approach taken in the bigquery client: https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquerystorage/pull/263/files.
timeline.author: thiagotnunes

replies.bodyText:
The same error is also retried for streaming queries, and this check could probably use the existing check in SpannerExceptionFactory: 
  
    
      java-spanner/google-cloud-spanner/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/spanner/SpannerExceptionFactory.java
    
    
         Line 233
      in
      b264100
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private static boolean isRetryable(ErrorCode code, @Nullable Throwable cause) { 
        
    
  

. It's still just as hacky, but it would keep it confined to one method.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.message:
fix: retries InternalException on PDML transaction

When the exception is an EOS, we should retry the exception.

refactor: re-uses spanner exception retry logic

Re-uses the retry logic applied by the spanner exception factory for
retrying EOS internal exceptions in pdml transactions.

timeline.bodyText: I extracted these predicates into their own classes that are now exposed to the PartitionedDmlTransaction. This was the cleanest / lowest impact way I could find to de-duplicate the EOS retryable logic.
timeline.author: thiagotnunes

timeline.message: fix: adds / changes headers in files

timeline.bodyText: Here and below, if we could remove the references to internal issues that would be great. I don't know why they were there before. Folks working on this repo are unlikely to have access to those so no point exposing them.
timeline.author: skuruppu

replies.bodyText: No worries, will tackle this in a following PR.
replies.author: thiagotnunes
